alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 04 at 11:33AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Indiana, including the following county, Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1129 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Heavy rain has ended but flooding concerns will continue into the early afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Crawfordsville, Ladoga, New Market, Waveland and New Ross. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
